title: [Snow Leopard][new.google.com] Arabic fonts are visible as gibberish text

sentences.text: What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.2 Arabic font is converted to gibberish text.
- Mac Safari, Firefox, Leopard Chrome and windows Chrome works fine.
- This happens on SL clean install and upgraded SL machine.
(No comment was entered for this change.)
I think this is critical enough to be in Mstone-4 bucket.
rohitbm, how about Hebrew, Thai, Hindi?
Jshin, News.google.com doesn't work for following languages.
I need a Mac ninja here.
Perhaps this is a sandboxing issue?
I know Avi also recently made some changes to our default font handling, perhaps that  had some ripple effects for arabic languages?
the changes I made were for the cursive and fantasy families (see http://codereview.chromium.org/335031/diff/10016/10020 ).
before my font changes were made.
It looks like we're not getting glyphs.
This seems to do this even with --no-sandbox.
Will gladly take a look, but FYI: I'm dealing with  Issue 22659  now which is releaseblock- beta.
Pinkerton: according to Avi --no-sandbox doesn't solve this so it's likely not a  sandboxing issue.
(No comment was entered for this change.)
The problem is with text who's font is set to Arial, resetting the font-face attribute of  the affected text to sans-serif causes the arabic text to be displayed properly.
(No comment was entered for this change.)

Yes , I have the same problem , when I update it to version 4.0.237.0 on snow leopard , the arabic font shows  something like squares , this is weird :( , and even in the last update , still same thing.
any solution for this issue pls ?
Which was a WebKit roll from r50258-r50313 :
Jeremy, thank you for figuring it out.
Although very unlikely, is this also broken on Safari + Webkit trunk on Snowleopard?
How about other languages written in complex scripts (e.g. Hindi, Thai)?
BTW, shouldn't we have a webkit buildbot on Mac OS 10.6 (Snowleopard)?
bug filed on it, I'll file one.
FYI: filed bug 27879 for Mac OS 10.6 build bot.
Not broken under Safari+WebKit r50918, FWIW.
This issue does not happen for other complex scripts language, tested in Hindi, Thai and other Indian languages, all works fine.
jshin: Thanks for the tips but with Mitz's help I think we have a way forward here.
We're  reverting the problematic patch on the beta branch and switching from ATSUI -> Core  Text rendering on trunk which fixes this problem.
I have been wondering why Chromium uses ATSUI for a long time.
(If I recall correctly,  Mac Chromium does not support Tiger or prior, which requires ATSUI.)
hbono: I think it's just legacy.
You're right there's no reason not to switch.
on a CL for that now once I can get a revert of the problematic CL for this bug on the  beta branch.
The following revision refers to this bug:
Revert WebKit r50529 on the WebKit 249 branch.
The following revision refers to this bug:
Revert 32532 - Revert WebKit r50529 on the WebKit 249 branch.
Moving to M5 since we have an M4 fix.
Moving back to M-4 and releaseblock beta till we can get a fix onto the dev branch.
Patch to switch us from ATSUI -> Core Text rendering up at:
